LuaScript:
function onload()
    assetSpread = getObjectFromGUID('7e4572')

    assetSpread.call('shuffleDeck')
    assetSpread.call("clickrefillassets")
    refillWonders()

    findPosition('d3ae38')
end

function onPlayerEndTurn()
    assetSpread = getObjectFromGUID('7e4572')
   

    assetSpread.call("clickrefillassets")

    -- trash cards


    refillWonders()

end

function trashCards()
    trashZone = getObjectFromGUID('bb2afe')
    trashObjects = trashZone.getObjects()
    print(trashObjects)
    print(trash)
    for _,obj in ipairs(trashObjects) do
        print(obj)        
    end
end

function shuffleWonders()
    assetdeck = findObjectsAtPosition( { -15.291,2.462, 12.309})

    print(assetdeck)
    assetdeck.shuffle()

end

function refillWonders()

    slots = {
        {-11.293, 2.523, 8.07},
        {-11.293, 2.521, 10.525}
    }

    for _, obj in ipairs(slots) do
        card = findObjectsAtPosition(obj)
        if(card == nil or #card == 0 ) then
            dealoneto(obj)
        end
    end
end


function findObjectsAtPosition(localPos)
    --We convert that local position to a global table position
    local globalPos = self.positionToWorld(localPos)
    --We then do a raycast of a sphere on that position to find objects there
    --It returns a list of hits which includes references to what it hit
    local objList = Physics.cast({
        origin=globalPos, --Where the cast takes place
        direction={0,1,0}, --Which direction it moves (up is shown)
        type=2, --Type. 2 is "sphere"
        size={0.5,0.5,0.5}, --How large that sphere is
        max_distance=1, --How far it moves. Just a little bit
        debug=false --If it displays the sphere when casting.
    })

    --Now we have objList which contains any and all objects in that area.
    --But we only want decks and cards. So we will create a new list
    local decksAndCards = {}
    --Then go through objList adding any decks/cards to our new list
    print(objList)
    print(#objList)
    for _, obj in ipairs(objList) do
        if obj.hit_object.tag == "Deck" or obj.hit_object.tag == "Card" then
            table.insert(decksAndCards, obj.hit_object)
        end
    end

    --Now we return this to where it was called with the information
    return decksAndCards
end

function dealoneto(targetpos)
   
    assetdeck = findObjectsAtPosition( { -15.290,2.306, 12.308})

    if(#assetdeck > 0) then
        for _, obj in ipairs(assetdeck) do

            if obj.name == "Deck" then
                obj.takeObject({position = self.positionToWorld(targetpos), flip=true})
          
            end

        end
   
    end
end


function findPosition(guid)
    local pos = self.positionToLocal(getObjectFromGUID(guid).getPosition())
    print(pos.x)
    print(pos.y)
    print(pos.z)
end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Assetbundle
ObjectStates.Description:
END TURN - Ends turn, passes to the next color on the list.

BACK - Ends turn, passes to the previous color on the list.

COLOR NAME - Press a color name to pass turn to them.

SET PLACE - Sets where the tool moves itself to. Position relative to the name on the table.

SET COLOR - Press to change the colors in the list.
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
--Prevents anyone but that color, host or promoted players from using buttons
--true is on, false is off
preventOtherColor = false

--Allows for colors to be put onto the list more than once
--There is still a max limit of turns in the list, due to limited space.
--true is on, false is off
allowRepeatSelections = false

--Limit on color selections that go into the list, do NOT INCREASE OVER 10.
--If you do, it will look ugly and dumb. It will still work though.
maxColorsInList = 10

function onSave()
    local data_to_save = {cl=colorList, ci=currentIndex, dp=deltaPos}
    saved_data = JSON.encode(data_to_save)
    return saved_data
end

function onload(saved_data)
    if saved_data ~= "" then
        --Set up information off of loaded_data
        local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
        colorList = loaded_data.cl
        currentIndex = loaded_data.ci
        deltaPos = loaded_data.dp
    else
        --Set up information for if there is no saved saved data
        colorList = {
            "White", "Brown", "Red", "Orange", "Yellow",
            "Green", "Teal", "Blue", "Purple", "Pink"
        }
        currentIndex = 1
        deltaPos = {0,1,4}  
    end
    --Check to make sure that all colors in colorList exist on the table.
    --If not, it resets the tool to its "inactive" state.
    local wasListReset = false
    for _, color in ipairs(colorList) do
        if Player[color].getPlayerHand() == nil then
            currentIndex = 0
            colorList = {}
            wasListReset = true
            break
        end
    end
    if wasListReset == false and #colorList > 0 then
        moveToolToPlayer()
    else
        broadcastToAll("No colors selected. Tool Inactive. Use [ff6666]Set Color[-] to pick colors.", {0.8,0.05,0.05})
    end

    createActiveModeButtons()
end

--[[            Active Buttons: End Turn, Back and Color Words            ]]

--End turn button
function clickEndTurn(_, clickerColor)
    if isClickAllowed(clickerColor) == true then
        if #colorList > 0 then
            printMessageToAll("endTurn", clickerColor)
            --Set index of next color
            if currentIndex == #colorList then currentIndex = 1
            else currentIndex = currentIndex + 1 end
            --Activate move
            moveToolToPlayer()
            moveColorIndicator(currentIndex)
            Global.call('onPlayerEndTurn')
        end
    end
end

--Back turn button
function clickBackTurn(_, clickerColor)
    if isClickAllowed(clickerColor) == true then
        if #colorList > 0 then
            printMessageToAll("backTurn", clickerColor)
            --Set index of next color
            if currentIndex == 1 then currentIndex = #colorList
            else currentIndex = currentIndex - 1 end
            --move tool move indicator
            moveToolToPlayer()
            moveColorIndicator(currentIndex)
        end
    end
end

--Color word click function
function clickActiveColor(playerColor, clickerColor, i)
    if isClickAllowed(clickerColor) == true then
        printMessageToAll("activeColor", clickerColor, playerColor)
        currentIndex = i
        moveToolToPlayer()
        moveColorIndicator(currentIndex)
    end
end

--[[            Active Buttons: Set Place and Set Color            ]]

--Set Place click function
function clickSetPlace(_, clickerColor)
    if isClickAllowed(clickerColor) == true then
        if #colorList > 0 then
            local playerHand = Player[colorList[currentIndex]].getPlayerHand()
            local toolPos = self.getPosition()
            deltaPos = {
                playerHand.trigger_right_x * (toolPos.x - playerHand.pos_x) - playerHand.trigger_forward_x * (toolPos.z - playerHand.pos_z) ,
                toolPos.y - playerHand.pos_y,
                playerHand.trigger_forward_z * (toolPos.z - playerHand.pos_z) - playerHand.trigger_right_z * (toolPos.x - playerHand.pos_x) ,
            }
            self.setLock(true)
            broadcastToAll("Location for tool updated.", {1,1,1})
        end
    end
end

--Set color click function
function clickSetColor(_, clickerColor)
    if isClickAllowed(clickerColor) == true then
        colorList = {}
        self.AssetBundle.playTriggerEffect(0)
        self.clearButtons()
        Timer.destroy(self.getGUID().."spawnButtons")
        Timer.create({
            identifier=self.getGUID().."spawnButtons", delay=0.5,
            function_name="clickSetColorTimer", function_owner=self
        })
    end
end
--Timer trigger from clickSetColor
function clickSetColorTimer()
    createEditModeButtons()
end

--[[            Edit Button Control            ]]

--Color button click function
function clickEditColor(playerColor, clickerColor)
    if Player[playerColor].getPlayerHand() then
        if allowRepeatSelections == true or getOffsetFromColorList(playerColor) == nil then
            if #colorList <= maxColorsInList then
                table.insert(colorList, playerColor)
                addColorToColorList(playerColor)
            else
                broadcastToAll(maxColorsInList .. " is the maximum number of entries you can have in the color list.", {0.8,0.05,0.05})
            end
        else
            broadcastToAll(playerColor.." is already on the turn-order list.", {0.8,0.05,0.05})
        end
    else
        broadcastToAll(playerColor.." is not a hand zone color available on this table.", {0.8,0.05,0.05})
    end
end

--Click function for undo
function clickUndoColor()
    if #colorList > 0 then
        removeColorFromColorList()
        table.remove(colorList, #colorList)
    end
end

--Submit function to submit colors
function clickSubmitColors()
    self.AssetBundle.playTriggerEffect(1)
    self.clearButtons()
    if #colorList > 0 then
        currentIndex = 1
        moveToolToPlayer()
    else
        currentIndex = 0
        self.setColorTint({0,0,0})
        broadcastToAll("No colors selected. Tool Inactive. Use [ff6666]Set Color[-] to pick colors.", {0.8,0.05,0.05})
    end
    createActiveModeButtons()
end

--[[            Utility functions            ]]

--Finds what index number of colorList the current turn is
function getOffsetFromColorList(c)
    for i, color in ipairs(colorList) do
        if color == c then
            return i
        end
    end
    return nil
end

--Moves the tool to whichever seat currentIndex of colorList is.
function moveToolToPlayer()
    self.setLock(true)
    local playerHand = Player[colorList[currentIndex]].getPlayerHand()
    if playerHand then
        local rot = {0, playerHand.rot_y + 180, 0}
        local pos = {
            playerHand.pos_x + (playerHand.trigger_forward_x * deltaPos[3]) + (playerHand.trigger_right_x * deltaPos[1]),
            playerHand.pos_y + deltaPos[2],
            playerHand.pos_z + (playerHand.trigger_forward_z * deltaPos[3]) + (playerHand.trigger_right_z * deltaPos[1])
        }
        self.setPosition(pos)
        self.setRotation(rot)
        self.AssetBundle.playTriggerEffect(2)
        self.setColorTint(stringColorToRGB(colorList[currentIndex]))
        broadcastToAll("-"..colorList[currentIndex].."'s Turn-", stringColorToRGB(colorList[currentIndex]))
    else
        broadcastToAll("Cannot pass turn to "..colorList[currentIndex]..". It does not exist on this table.", {0.8,0.05,0.05})
    end
end

--Removes colors from colorList that do not exist on the actual table
function removeInvalidColorsFromColorList()
    for i, color in ipairs(colorList) do
        local playerHand = Player[color].getPlayerHand()
        if not playerHand then
            table.remove(colorList, i)
            removeInvalidColorsFromColorList()
            break
        end
    end
end

--Creates the printToAll strings and prints them
function printMessageToAll(type, clickerColor, playerColor)
    local stringToPrint, key = "", type
    if colorList[currentIndex] == clickerColor then key = key .. "Match"
    else key = key .. "Miss" end
    --This for loop is assembling an approprite string from a table of strings
    --Certain strings are replaced by parameter data
    for _, string in ipairs(printMessageStringGenerationData[key]) do
        if string == "CLICKC_NAME" then
            stringToPrint = stringToPrint..Player[clickerColor].steam_name
        elseif string == "CURRENTC" then
            stringToPrint = stringToPrint..colorList[currentIndex]
        elseif string == "PLAYERC" then
            stringToPrint = stringToPrint..playerColor
        else
            stringToPrint = stringToPrint..string
        end
    end
    printToAll(stringToPrint, stringColorToRGB(colorList[currentIndex]))
end

--Used to determine if a player is allowed to click a given button
function isClickAllowed(clickerColor)
    if preventOtherColor == false then
        return true
    else
        if Player[clickerColor].host==true then
            return true
        elseif Player[clickerColor].promoted==true then
            return true
        elseif clickerColor==colorList[currentIndex] then
            return true
        elseif clickerColor=="" then
            return true
        else
            return false
        end
    end
end

--[[            Button Creation/Destruction/Editing            ]]

--Spawns End/Back/Set buttons and color buttons (for the word list)
function createActiveModeButtons()
    --Marker next to name
    local iOffset = currentIndex
    if #colorList > 0 then
        self.createButton({
            label=string.char(8273).."               "..string.char(8273),
            click_function="none", function_owner=self, height=0, width=0,
            position={2.5,0.15,-2.54+0.57*(iOffset-1)}, font_size=240
        })
    end
    --End/Back/Set buttons
    for _, param in ipairs(activeModeButtonParams) do
        self.createButton({
            click_function=param.cf, function_owner=self,
            position=param.p, height=param.h, width=param.w,
        })
    end
    removeInvalidColorsFromColorList()
    for i, color in ipairs(colorList) do
        local funcName = "clickActive"..color
        local func = function(o,c) clickActiveColor(color, c, i) end
        --Display names only
        self.createButton({
            label=color, click_function="none", function_owner=self,
            position={2.5,0.15,-2.54+0.57*(i-1)}, height=0, width=0, font_size=240
        })
        --Clickable button under name
        self.createButton({
            click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position={2.5,0.04,-2.58+0.57*(i-1)}, height=260, width=1000
        })
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
    end
end

--Spawns buttons for colors (editing color list)
function createEditModeButtons()
    for i, param in ipairs(editModeButtonParams) do
        local pos, funcName = "", "clickEdit"..param.c
        local func = function(o,c) clickEditColor(param.c, c) end
        if param.r == 1 then pos = {4.55,0,-2.5+0.923*(i-1)}
        else pos = {5.48,0,-2.5+0.923*(i-6)} end
        self.createButton({
            click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=400, width=400,
        })
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
    end
    self.createButton({
        click_function="clickUndoColor", function_owner=self,
        position={4.55,0,2.37}, height=550, width=400,
    })
    self.createButton({
        click_function="clickSubmitColors", function_owner=self,
        position={5.48,0,2.37}, height=550, width=400,
    })
end

--Moves indicator down on the color name list
function moveColorIndicator(i)
    self.editButton({index=0, position={2.5,0.15,-2.54+0.57*(i-1)}})
end

--Adds names to the color list in edit mode only, displays only
function addColorToColorList(playerColor)
    local i = #colorList
    self.createButton({
        label=playerColor, click_function="none", function_owner=self,
        position={2.5,0.15,-2.54+0.57*(i-1)}, height=0, width=0, font_size=240
    })
end

--Removes the last entry fro mthe color list in edit mode only
function removeColorFromColorList()
    self.removeButton(11+#colorList)
end

--[[            Data Tables            ]]

--Button creation data
activeModeButtonParams = {
    {cf="clickEndTurn", h=1240, w=1900, p={-1.18,0.05,-1.4}},
    {cf="clickBackTurn", h=540, w=1900, p={-1.18,0.05,0.74}},
    {cf="clickSetPlace", h=540, w=900, p={-2.22,0.05,2.135}},
    {cf="clickSetColor", h=540, w=900, p={-0.12,0.05,2.135}},
}
editModeButtonParams = {
    {c="White", r=1}, {c="Red", r=1}, {c="Yellow", r=1},
    {c="Teal", r=1}, {c="Purple", r=1},
    {c="Brown", r=2}, {c="Orange", r=2}, {c="Green", r=2},
    {c="Blue", r=2}, {c="Pink", r=2}
}

--Data table which is used for printToAll
printMessageStringGenerationData = {
    endTurnMatch = {"CLICKC_NAME", " ended their turn."},
    endTurnMiss = {"CLICKC_NAME", " ended ", "CURRENTC", "'s turn."},
    backTurnMatch = {"CLICKC_NAME", " ended their turn. [i](Back)[/i]"},
    backTurnMiss = {"CLICKC_NAME", " ended ", "CURRENTC", "'s turn. [i](Back)[/i]"},
    activeColorMatch = {"CLICKC_NAME", " ended their turn, passing to ", "PLAYERC", "."},
    activeColorMiss = {"CLICKC_NAME", " ended ", "CURRENTC", "'s turn, passing to ", "PLAYERC", "."},
}

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Token
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
function onload()
    self.createButton({
        click_function="clickrefillassets", function_owner=self,
        position={-2.554,0.171,-0.821}, height=300, width=820, color={1,1,1,0}
    })

    -- always shuffle deck
    shuffleDeck()
end

function shuffleDeck()
    assetdeck = getObjectFromGUID('48f9be')

    assetdeck.shuffle()
end

function clickrefillassets()
    slots = {
        {1.532,0.171,0.221},
        {0.440,0.171,0.221},
        {-0.654,0.171,0.221},
        {-1.74,0.171,0.221},
        {-2.833,0.171,0.221}
    }
    -- getcount(slots)
    -- print(getcount(slots))
    for _, obj in ipairs(slots) do
        card = findObjectsAtPosition(obj)
        if(card == nil or getcount(card) == 0 ) then
            dealoneto(obj)
        end
    end
end

function dealoneto(targetpos)

    assetdeck = findObjectsAtPosition({2.88,0.27,0.21})

    if(getcount(assetdeck) > 0) then
        for _, obj in ipairs(assetdeck) do

            obj.takeObject({position = self.positionToWorld(targetpos)})
         
        end
        
    end
end

function findObjectsAtPosition(localPos)
    --We convert that local position to a global table position
    local globalPos = self.positionToWorld(localPos)
    --We then do a raycast of a sphere on that position to find objects there
    --It returns a list of hits which includes references to what it hit
    local objList = Physics.cast({
        origin=globalPos, --Where the cast takes place
        direction={0,1,0}, --Which direction it moves (up is shown)
        type=2, --Type. 2 is "sphere"
        size={2,2,2}, --How large that sphere is
        max_distance=1, --How far it moves. Just a little bit
        debug=false --If it displays the sphere when casting.
    })

    --Now we have objList which contains any and all objects in that area.
    --But we only want decks and cards. So we will create a new list
    local decksAndCards = {}
    --Then go through objList adding any decks/cards to our new list
    for _, obj in ipairs(objList) do
        if obj.hit_object.tag == "Deck" or obj.hit_object.tag == "Card" then
            table.insert(decksAndCards, obj.hit_object)
        end
    end

    --Now we return this to where it was called with the information
    return decksAndCards
end

function getcount(tbl)
    tct = 0
    for _, obj in ipairs(tbl) do
        tct = tct + 1
        --print(obj)
    end

    return tct
end
-- position={1.532,0.171,0.221}
-- position={0.440,0.171,0.221}
-- position={-0.654,0.171,0.221}
-- position={-1.74,0.171,0.221}
-- position={-2.833,0.171,0.221}

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Token
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
--Creates invisible button onload, hidden under the "REFILL" on the deck pad
function onLoad()
    self.createButton({
        click_function="click_refillDeck", function_owner=self,
        position={0,0.1,-1.42}, height=300, width=620, color={1,1,1,0}
    })

    self.createButton({
        click_function="click_getone", function_owner=self,
        position={0,0.1,1.62}, height=300, width=1200, color={1,1,1,0}
    })


    --This is how I found the positions to check for cards
    --That GUID was a card I put on it
    
    -- local pos = self.positionToLocal(getObjectFromGUID("7851b0").getPosition())
    -- print(pos.x)
    -- print(pos.y)
    -- print(pos.z)

    -- local pos = self.positionToLocal(getObjectFromGUID("893e1c").getPosition())
    -- print(pos.x)
    -- print(pos.y)
    -- print(pos.z)

    --Local positions for each pile of cards
    pos_discard =  {-0.893, 0.174,0.058}
    pos_draw ={0.892, 0.174, 0.045}


    --This is which way is face down for a card or deck relative to the tool
    rot_offset = {x=0, y=0, z=180}

    getOneAfterShulle = false
end

--Activates when button is clicked
function click_refillDeck()
    --This gets all decks and cards in the discard area
    local discardItemList = findObjectsAtPosition(pos_discard)
    --This is where we want to put those discarded cards
    local pos = self.positionToWorld(pos_draw)
    --This is how we want the card rotated
    local rot = self.getRotation()
    rot = {rot.x+rot_offset.x, rot.y+rot_offset.y, rot.z+rot_offset.z}

    --This is going through and placing all llcards/decks with this info
    for _, obj in ipairs(discardItemList) do
        obj.setPositionSmooth(pos, false, true)
        obj.setRotationSmooth(rot)
    end

    --We check if any cards were moved before we go to shuffle
    if #discardItemList > 0 then
        --Finally, we start a short timer to shuffle the cards after they move
        Timer.destroy("shuffleTimer_"..self.getGUID())
        Timer.create({
            identifier = "shuffleTimer_"..self.getGUID(),
            function_name = "timer_shuffle",
            function_owner = self,
            delay = 0.3
        })
    end
end

--This is used by another function to locate information on what is in an area
function findObjectsAtPosition(localPos)
    --We convert that local position to a global table position
    local globalPos = self.positionToWorld(localPos)
    --We then do a raycast of a sphere on that position to find objects there
    --It returns a list of hits which includes references to what it hit
    local objList = Physics.cast({
        origin=globalPos, --Where the cast takes place
        direction={0,1,0}, --Which direction it moves (up is shown)
        type=2, --Type. 2 is "sphere"
        size={2,2,2}, --How large that sphere is
        max_distance=1, --How far it moves. Just a little bit
        debug=false --If it displays the sphere when casting.
    })

    --Now we have objList which contains any and all objects in that area.
    --But we only want decks and cards. So we will create a new list
    local decksAndCards = {}
    --Then go through objList adding any decks/cards to our new list
    for _, obj in ipairs(objList) do
        if obj.hit_object.tag == "Deck" or obj.hit_object.tag == "Card" then
            table.insert(decksAndCards, obj.hit_object)
        end
    end

    --Now we return this to where it was called with the information
    return decksAndCards
end

--Activated by a timer to shuffle deck
function timer_shuffle()
    --This uses our findObjects function to find the deck in in the draw area
    local discardItemList = findObjectsAtPosition(pos_draw)
    --We should only have 1 item here, and it should be a deck
    --But just in case, we will go through any and all returns
    for _, obj in ipairs(discardItemList) do
        --Final check to make sure its a deck we're trying to shuffle
        if obj.tag == "Deck" then
            obj.shuffle()                    
        end
    end

    if(getOneAfterShulle) then
        click_getone(lastobject,lastplayer)
    end
end

function click_getone(object,player)
    getOneAfterShulle = false

    local drawList = findObjectsAtPosition(pos_draw)

    count = 0
    for _, obj in ipairs(drawList) do
        obj.deal(1,player)
        count = count + 1
    end

    if count == 0 then
        -- deck empty, refill then get one again
        getOneAfterShulle = true
        lastobject = object
        lastplayer = player
        click_refillDeck(object,player)                
    end
end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Token
Custom_Token
Custom_Token
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
--Creates invisible button onload, hidden under the "REFILL" on the deck pad
        function onLoad()
            self.createButton({
                click_function="click_refillDeck", function_owner=self,
                position={0,0.1,-1.42}, height=300, width=620, color={1,1,1,0}
            })

            self.createButton({
                click_function="click_getone", function_owner=self,
                position={0,0.1,1.62}, height=300, width=1200, color={1,1,1,0}
            })


            --This is how I found the positions to check for cards
            --That GUID was a card I put on it
            
            -- local pos = self.positionToLocal(getObjectFromGUID("7851b0").getPosition())
            -- print(pos.x)
            -- print(pos.y)
            -- print(pos.z)

            -- local pos = self.positionToLocal(getObjectFromGUID("893e1c").getPosition())
            -- print(pos.x)
            -- print(pos.y)
            -- print(pos.z)

            --Local positions for each pile of cards
            pos_discard =  {-0.893, 0.174,0.058}
            pos_draw ={0.892, 0.174, 0.045}

            --This is which way is face down for a card or deck relative to the tool
            rot_offset = {x=0, y=0, z=180}

            getOneAfterShulle = false
        end

        --Activates when button is clicked
        function click_refillDeck()
            --This gets all decks and cards in the discard area
            local discardItemList = findObjectsAtPosition(pos_discard)
            --This is where we want to put those discarded cards
            local pos = self.positionToWorld(pos_draw)
            --This is how we want the card rotated
            local rot = self.getRotation()
            rot = {rot.x+rot_offset.x, rot.y+rot_offset.y, rot.z+rot_offset.z}

            --This is going through and placing all llcards/decks with this info
            for _, obj in ipairs(discardItemList) do
                obj.setPositionSmooth(pos, false, true)
                obj.setRotationSmooth(rot)
            end

            --We check if any cards were moved before we go to shuffle
            if #discardItemList > 0 then
                --Finally, we start a short timer to shuffle the cards after they move
                Timer.destroy("shuffleTimer_"..self.getGUID())
                Timer.create({
                    identifier = "shuffleTimer_"..self.getGUID(),
                    function_name = "timer_shuffle",
                    function_owner = self,
                    delay = 0.3
                })
            end
        end

        --This is used by another function to locate information on what is in an area
        function findObjectsAtPosition(localPos)
            --We convert that local position to a global table position
            local globalPos = self.positionToWorld(localPos)
            --We then do a raycast of a sphere on that position to find objects there
            --It returns a list of hits which includes references to what it hit
            local objList = Physics.cast({
                origin=globalPos, --Where the cast takes place
                direction={0,1,0}, --Which direction it moves (up is shown)
                type=2, --Type. 2 is "sphere"
                size={2,2,2}, --How large that sphere is
                max_distance=1, --How far it moves. Just a little bit
                debug=false --If it displays the sphere when casting.
            })

            --Now we have objList which contains any and all objects in that area.
            --But we only want decks and cards. So we will create a new list
            local decksAndCards = {}
            --Then go through objList adding any decks/cards to our new list
            for _, obj in ipairs(objList) do
                if obj.hit_object.tag == "Deck" or obj.hit_object.tag == "Card" then
                    table.insert(decksAndCards, obj.hit_object)
                end
            end

            --Now we return this to where it was called with the information
            return decksAndCards
        end

        --Activated by a timer to shuffle deck
        function timer_shuffle()
            --This uses our findObjects function to find the deck in in the draw area
            local discardItemList = findObjectsAtPosition(pos_draw)
            --We should only have 1 item here, and it should be a deck
            --But just in case, we will go through any and all returns
            for _, obj in ipairs(discardItemList) do
                --Final check to make sure its a deck we're trying to shuffle
                if obj.tag == "Deck" then
                    obj.shuffle()                    
                end
            end

            if(getOneAfterShulle) then
                click_getone(lastobject,lastplayer)
            end
        end

        function click_getone(object,player)
            getOneAfterShulle = false
            print(player)
            local drawList = findObjectsAtPosition(pos_draw)
            print(drawList)
            count = 0
            for _, obj in ipairs(drawList) do
                obj.deal(1,player)
                count = count + 1
            end

            if count == 0 then
                -- deck empty, refill then get one again
                getOneAfterShulle = true
                lastobject = object
                lastplayer = player
                click_refillDeck(object,player)                
            end
        end
